item.title: Asian Investors Brace for Renewed Tariff Fallout: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian stocks face renewed pressure Tuesday after President Donald Trump announced higher tariffs on key regional trading partners including Japan and South Korea.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

item.title: Restructuring Pressure Rises in Italy and Nordics, BCG Says
item.description: The number of firms under pressure to overhaul or restructure their businesses has risen sharply in Italy and the Nordics, putting both large companies and their supplier networks at risk, according to a report by Boston Consulting Group.
item.dc:creator: Rose Henderson

media:content.media:description: A view of Milan from the tourist terrace of the Milan Cathedral in Milan, Italy, on Wednesday Nov. 15, 2023. A possible downgrade of Italy to junk this week would be hugely symbolic, potentially consequential — and very controversial.

item.title: Why CEOs Should Stop 'Outsourcing' Politics
item.description: Bloomberg Opinion's Gautam Mukunda explains why CEOs should stop "outsourcing" politics. Mukunda's opinions are his own. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: WNBA Liberty's Valuation Fuels Barclays Center Expansion
item.description: After spending about $3.3 billion to gain control of a Brooklyn-based sports empire, owners Joe Tsai and Clara Wu Tsai have won their first title. Now they want to keep expanding. BSE Global, the parent company of the Nets, Liberty and Barclays Center that the Tsais acquired in 2019, has a strategy to make Brooklyn a bigger destination, which will help build a larger fanbase. The expansion initiative is eclectic, including a wine club, online magazine and potential investments in nearby performance venues, and eventually restaurants and hotels. The Tsais will also shift their focus to another team that needs attention- The Brooklyn Nets. Sam Zussman aims to build on that. He joined BSE as CEO two years ago after more than 15 years at IMG, a conglomerate that includes a media company and events manager. Zussman joins and Bloomberg News Global Business of Sports Reporter Randall Williams to discuss what's next for Brooklyn sports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Warns of Blackouts in Precursor to Help Coal
item.description: Blackouts in the US could skyrocket by 2030 amid an expected increase in power demand brought on by AI, according to a Trump administration report seen as a precursor to a broader intervention to help keep coal-fired power plants from closing early.
item.dc:creator: Ari Natter

item.title: Gold Miner Aura Minerals Seeks $210 Million in US Listing
item.description: Aura Minerals Inc. is seeking to raise about $210 million in a US listing, as the gold and copper miner looks to expand its investor base.
item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Morgan, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A dump truck operates in an open pit at the Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold mine, jointly owned by Rio Tinto Group's Turquoise Hill Resources Ltd. unit and state-owned Erdenes Oyu Tolgoi LLC, in Khanbogd, the South Gobi desert, Mongolia, on Saturday, July 23, 2016. Mongolia exported 817,000 tons of copper concentrate in the first half of the year compared with 663,800 tons a year earlier, an increase of 23.1 percent. Photographer: Taylor Weidman

item.title: Exxon Sees $1.5 Billion Earnings Hit From Lower Oil, Gas Prices
item.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. expects lower oil and gas prices to reduce the company’s earnings by about $1.5 billion as a volatile quarter for commodity prices weighs on second-quarter profits.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Crowley

media:content.media:description: A vehicle is refueled at an Exxon Mobil gas station in Little Rock, Arkansas, US, on Thursday, April 3, 2025. Wall Street economists said the US risks a recession this year and inflation could return to pandemic levels following the Trump administration's announcement of major tariffs on global trading partners.

item.title: S&P Says It’s Looking at Cutting Insurer Centene to Junk Status
item.description: S&P Global Ratings said it’s considering cutting Centene Corp.’s credit ratings to junk, citing the health insurer’s suspending its 2025 profit outlook.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Hall

media:content.media:description: The building housing Centene Corporation headquarters in Clayton, Missouri. Photographer: Jeff Roberson/AP Photo

item.title: Japan Stocks Set to Follow Yen Lower After New Tariff Deadline
item.description: Japanese equities were poised join the yen in moving lower as investors in Tokyo awoke on Tuesday to weeks of more uncertainty over US tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Brett Miller

media:content.media:description: Containers under gantry cranes at a shipping terminal in Yokohama, Japan, on Tuesday, April 15, 2025. Japan is scheduled to release trade figures on April 17.

item.title: UK’s Schroder Family Facing Defining Moment for City Dynasty
item.description: A once-unimaginable sale or breakup of the clan’s 221-year-old City of London firm is seeming more and more feasible to onlookers.
item.dc:creator: Leonard Kehnscherper

media:content.media:description: Schroeders Bank at 1 London Wall Place in London. London, UK, on Thrusday, June 19, 2025.

item.title: Japan’s R&I Helps Hong Kong Funds by Reaffirming Top US Credit Rating
item.description: For Hong Kong’s pension fund managers fretting over the risk of forced divestments of US Treasuries, Japan’s Rating and Investment Information Inc. has some words of reassurance.
item.dc:creator: Takahiko Hyuga, Issei Hazama

item.title: Meiji Yasuda Life to Shun Super-Long Japan Debt for Year or More
item.description: Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Co. plans to avoid actively investing in Japanese super-long-term government bonds for the next 1-2 years as interest rates may rise and supply pressures build.
item.dc:creator: Masahiro Hidaka

media:content.media:description: The Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Co. headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, Jan. 19, 2024. Japanese life insurers are the main buyers of domestic sovereign bonds due in more than 10 years and typically increase purchases toward the end of the fiscal year. They are holding off as the earthquake that struck Ishikawa Prefecture on Jan. 1 reduced the likelihood that the BOJ will end negative rates at its meeting on Jan. 23.

item.title: Investors Flock to Dollar as Trump Unveils US Tariff Plans
item.description: The dollar jumped the most in three weeks after President Donald Trump unveiled a wave of proposed tariffs, a sign investors are confident the US economy can largely withstand the impact of trade disputes.
item.dc:creator: Carter Johnson, Naomi Tajitsu, Malavika Kaur Makol

item.title: Blackstone to Buy Allegiant Florida Resort for $200 Million
item.description: Blackstone Inc. has agreed to purchase Allegiant Travel Co.’s Sunseeker Resort for $200 million, far less than the $720 million that the parent of Allegiant Airlines spent building the beleaguered retreat.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Mary Schlangenstein

media:content.media:description: Sunseeker Resort in Charlotte Harbor, Florida.

item.title: Equities Fall Amid Trump's Tariff Salvo | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Sonali Basak, Emily Graffeo and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Slide as Trump’s Tariff Plans Boost Dollar: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks fell from all-time highs and the dollar climbed after President Donald Trump began unveiling his tariff plans, with the US setting levies for nations such as Japan, South Korea and South Africa starting in August — triggering a selloff in their currencies.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: The logo for Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Ltd. (HKEx) displayed on a screen at the Exchange Square complex in Hong Kong, China, on Wednesday, Feb. 26, 2025. Hong Kong's stock exchange reported its highest quarterly profit in nearly four years after China's stimulus measures boosted trading and listing volume.

item.title: Stocks Slip as Trump Threatens Tariffs on Several Trade Partners
item.description: US equities tumbled Monday as trade fears returned in full force, with President Donald Trump set to impose 25% tariffs on Japan and South Korea, and even higher levies on South Africa and Myanmar.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: A container ship at the Yokkaichi Port in Yokkaichi, Japan.

item.title: Left Argues Short Selling Case Should Be Civil, Not Criminal
item.description: A lawyer for Andrew Left urged a judge on Monday to toss out securities fraud charges against the activist short seller, arguing that a criminal case with a threat of decades behind bars isn’t the way to create new rules for the industry.
item.dc:creator: Erik Larson

media:content.media:description: Andrew Left, founder of Citron Research, arrives at federal court in Los Angeles, California, US, on Monday, July 7, 2025. Activist short seller Andrew Left is set to appear in federal court Monday in a securities fraud case that shook the industry a year ago, setting up a battle over investor tips and free speech.

item.title: Carney Says New Oil Pipeline Proposal Likely in Canada
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said a new oil pipeline to Canada’s West Coast is “highly likely” to be proposed as a nation-building project, which could mean it becomes part of Ottawa’s push to fast-track major developments under new legislation.
item.dc:creator: Paula Sambo

media:content.media:description: Mark Carney, Canada's prime minister, speaks at LeBreton Flats on Canada Day in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, on Tuesday, July 1, 2025. Canada Day, which has been celebrated since 1868, also coincides this year with the 60th anniversary of the Canadian flag.

item.title: Trump Should Stop Attacking the Fed, William Dudley Says
item.description: Bloomberg Opinion's William Dudley, former president of the New York Federal Reserve, says pressuring the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates is counterproductive on "Bloomberg The Close." Dudley's opinions are his own. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: East Coast Gasoline Stockpiles Swell as Key Pipeline Adds Volume
item.description: The operator of the largest US fuel pipeline system has raised shipments on a key gasoline line, increasing supplies for East Coast drivers in the peak summer travel season.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Risser, Jack Wittels

media:content.media:description: Old Westbury, N.Y.: Traffic builds on the westbound LIE, exit 39 Glen Cove Rd. on Monday in Old Westbury, New York on July 5, 2021. (Photo by Howard Schnapp/Newsday RM via Getty Images)

item.title: Tracking Every Trump Tariff and Its Economic Effect
item.description: For the full experience visit: Tracking Every Trump Tariff and Its Economic Effect
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Diamond, Adrian Leung, Jane Pong, Christopher Udemans, Jason Kao

item.title: Oil Rises as Saudis Bet Market Can Absorb OPEC+ Output Hike
item.description: Oil rose as Saudi Arabia surprised customers in Asia by hiking prices for its main crude grade, a vote of confidence that the market can absorb extra OPEC barrels.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Jack Wittels

media:content.media:description: Storage tanks and oil processing facilities at an oil refinery and terminal in Ras Tanura, Saudi Arabia.

item.title: ECB’s Villeroy Sees Quantitative Easing as Best Unconventional Policy Tool
item.description: The European Central Bank’s best unconventional instrument for steering monetary policy is large-scale asset purchases, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Langley, Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: Governor of France's central bank Francois Villeroy De Galhau.

item.title: Global X CEO on Product Lineup (SHLD, AIQ, BOTZ, GXIG)
item.description: Global X CEO Ryan O’Connor discusses the Global X Defense Tech ETF (ticker: SHLD) which is currently up 58% this year. He also discusses the Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (ticker: AIQ), Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (ticker: BOTZ), and the Investment Grade Corporate Bond ETF (ticker: GXIG). (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump to Impose 25% Tariff on Japan and South Korea | Bloomberg Markets 7/7/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Rock Creek Group CEO and Founder Afsaneh Beschloss, Bloomberg's Shawn Donnan, Ed Ludlow and Julie Fine. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Unveils Tariffs Ranging From 25% to 40%
item.description: President Trump has announced plans to impose higher tariffs on goods from several countries, including Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and others, with rates ranging from 25% to 40%. Rep. Kathy Cantor, a Democrat from Florida, says she doesn't know why Trump is imposing tariffs on allies like Japan and South Korea. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tesla Stocks Down As Musk Forms the ‘America Party’ | Open Interest 7/07/2025
item.description: Get a jump start on the US trading day with Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Sonali Basak on "Bloomberg Open Interest." William Blair has downgraded Tesla shares as investors express dismay at a distracted Musk. Nations are chasing US trade deals ahead of tariffs going into effect on August 1st, meanwhile President Trump is optimistic that negotiations will finish soon. MNTN CEO joins Open Interest to discuss the future of television advertising after the company recently went public. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: I/O Fund's Kindig Reacts to More China Chip Curbs
item.description: Beth Kindig, I/O Fund lead technology analyst, says the potential chip curbs to prevent China from obtaining US semiconductors is a bullish demand signal for Nvidia. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Figma Heats Up Summer IPO Market Amid Software Listing Drought
item.description: Figma Inc.’s expected US initial public offering is shaping up as a potential summer blockbuster first-time stock sale, as investors look to back a rare debut from a fast-growing software company.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes
